abstract: Alan C. Greenberg, board member of Bear Stearns, is planning to give $360,000 to some of the bank’s lowest-paid workers.
snippet: Alan C. Greenberg, board member of Bear Stearns, is planning to give $360,000 to some of the bank’s lowest-paid workers.
lead_paragraph: Alan C. Greenberg, known as Ace, joined Bear Stearns back in 1949 as a clerk and rose through the trading division to become chief executive. Now 80 and still on the bank’s board, Mr. Greenberg is planning to give $360,000 to some of the bank’s lowest-paid workers, who may lose their jobs when Bear merges with JPMorgan Chase.
